38913617.review:
I've run this program for [i]thousands[/i] of hours as it runs outside of steam.

I use AMD Eyefinity (Counterpart to Nvidia 3D Surround), which treats my 3 monitors as if they were one single display. This makes my taskbar 5 feet long with the button waaaay to my left, the clock waaaay to my right, and maximizing windows will [i]Always[/i] span all 3 screens, making window management a pain.

Although DisplayFusion has many, many options i never use, it has proven quite useful for me to...
[list]
[*]Split a 1080*6000 wide display into three 1080*1920 chunks with 120 pixels of [b]bezel compensation[/b], allowing me to maximize windows that perfectly fit each monitor, as if they were still separate.
[*]Easily apply triple-wide wallpapers, with slideshow options.
[*]Apply a triple-wide [i]background for the boring Windows log-in screen[/i].
[*][b]Shrink the task bar back to only 1 monitor of my choice[/b].
[*]Use handy-dandy keyboard shortcuts for window manipulation.
[*][b]Save desktop icon layouts in case they bork up while changing Eyefinity/3DSurround/resolution settings.[/b][/list]

It's only problem is that it's not terribly user friendly, and most people won't touch half of it's features or more, but it's the only tool of it's type that I've used, and I've never felt the need to look for a different one.

[b]TL;DR[/b]: Consumes minimal resources and does everything to emulate "one" large Eyefinity monitor as if it were still split in three. Comes with several other features, and doesn't break your desktop if you stop the program.

35660701.review:
The best multi-monitor and desktop management tool I've used so far!

One of the best functions is providing a script database which execution can be mapped to key combinations. By mapping my keyboards programmable keys to match these shortcuts, I now have several buttons with advanced functionality: 
- A button for sleep with a 15-second cancel/accept pop window to prevent unwanted sleeping
- A button to dim all windows except the one being used, to dim my second screen when gaming
- A button to disable my second monitor, to save power and get rid of its light when watching a movie
- A button to switch default audio device, for switching between headset and desktop speakers.

Next, it offers a second monitor taskbar like the default windows one, with a start button on the left, and the time on the right. And for people with screens having a different resolution, its mouse management offers an option to prevent the mouse from getting stuck in the corners of the screen when the resolution does not match.

It also allows desktop shortcuts to be saved to a file, so they can easily be recovered. They can even be loaded upon switching monitor profiles, so you always have the desired desktop shortcuts available for the used profile / monitor layout. However, for me, the main usage of this function is when Windows forgets my desktop shortcut layout, after which I can easily reset it with a few clicks.

Finally, the wallpaper manager can manage the desktop wallpaper and the lock screen background. It can select wallpapers from many locations, from selected folders, online storage, and many online wallpaper providers.

In short, DisplayFusion can manage everything related to your desktop, wallpapers, keyboard shortcuts, monitor configurations and much more. Definitely recommended!

34139210.review:
Lets start with my complaints.
1. Uses what appears to be JPEG to compress desktop images, and makes them look horrible. It also takes about 20 seconds to load my configuration for some reason, until it does it just tiles my main desktop image over all monitors. Being the main feature I bought this product for makes me not reccomend it. There should at least be an option to allow me to not have compressed images.

2. changes how window management works, even with these settings disabled, trying to move a fullscreen window to a monitor above the one it is currently on causes it to snap into a window, then quickly go fullscreen on the monitor it was on before.

3. Multi-monitor taskbars are buggy. VERY buggy. the start button does nothing on my secondary monitors, there is no way to show my pinned applications on DF taskbar, the DF taskbars sometimes dissapear and will only reappear when I open the settings for them and hit apply (without changing anything.) I really want to use them because they allow me to see the time/date and sound/network settings unlike the normal windows 10 secondary taskbars, but they are basically unusable in this state.

But there's also things I like.
1. setting desktop wallpaper as different images on each monitor is easy.
2. ability to quickly change audio devices is quite handy when you use multiple soundcards on a single system
3. as stated above the DF taskbars would be much better than the standard windows 10 taskbar, if they worked right.
4. all of the customization options. Windows has become increasingly restrictive on how you can edit your workspace, this does its best to alleviate some of that.

Overall, its an ok program with a great vision, but seeing as I'm dissatisfied with the main reason I bought it, I cannot reccomend it in its current state.
I also had to let the program open and run for 5 minutes from steam to leave this review, because it did not count my time using it for some reason, not the program's fualt, but annoying.

This thing has potential and does most of what it claims, but it's got issues that go unaddressed. It can hog system resources without explanation, cause horrible graphics lag and outright crash resource hungry games. Tried to get support for these issues a while back and it was kind of brushed off with the old "Don't know what you are talking about, can you provide evidence?" and since then have acquired the undeniable evidence that it is THIS application that has been causing the majority of my problems in games since I started using it, and I am no longer using it as a result.

If you don't need your system resources, don't mind if a background application occasionally steals them all, this tool can do some really interesting things, but if you want something that manages desktop and monitor management without getting in the way of other applicaitons and staying well in the background, out of the way, this is NOT that application.

33782108.review:
Если вы хотите играть на одном мониторе и серфить интернет на другом или же просто иметь комфортабельное управление.
Настройка горячих клавиш для взаимодействия между мониторами - перемещение курсора между ними, перемещение окна (вплоть до перемещения окна в определенный угол и уменьшения его размера),
и великое подобных вариантов, а их количество пополняется - в самой программе доступны для загрузки дополнительные скрипты, правда не всегда их описание переведено).
Визуально, после инсталяции программы у вас появится (слева от "свернуть") кнопка, переносящая на нажатие окно на другой экран. Можно изменять заставки (на каждом мониторе отдельно), время бездействия до их появления, правда, вряд ли это необходимая функция.
Для запуска программы не требуется запуск Steam, что позволяет ей автоматически работать с включением компьютера.
Минусы, конечно,  есть, но не критичны, бывало, что в играх после случайноо переноса окна на другой монитор и обратно курсор начинал реагировать на движения на одном экране, а изображение менялось на другом (в данном случае проблема возникла с Friday the 13th: The Game, возможно, единичный случай), но решалось все повторным перемещением окна или, в крайнем случае, перезапуском игры.
Возможно даже удаленное управлние программой с клиентов дял мобильных систем. Распространяются мобильные клиенты для - Android, Ios, Windows 10 (имеется ввиду Windows-Store), Windows Phone и Blackberry.

Displayfusion ist die Referenz - und ein muss für jede Maschine mit 2- (oder natürlich auch mehreren) Bildschirmen.

Es bietet Tonnen an Funktionen! Es gibt absolut nichts- was ich vermisse und nichts zu meckern!
Ich nutze es seit ca. 3 Jahren im täglichen Einsatz und es läuft absolut stabil (Win 8.1).
Vorher habe ich das mittlerweile ebenfalls kostenpflichtige "Ultramon" benutzt, welches lange als Referenz galt. 
Displayfusion ist auf jeden Fall um ein Vielfaches besser, schneller, stabiler und bietet viel mehr Funktionen.

Bisher habe ich auch noch keine Programme gefunden, welche nicht von DF Unterstützt werden - in Sachen der Platzierung der zusätzlichen, ebenfalls frei Platzier- und konfigurierbaren Zusatzbuttons für die Programmtitelleiste.
Es klappt selbst bei Programmen, welche nicht die Windows-Standardbar benutzen.

Alle Aktionen lassen sich mit frei belegbaren Shortcuts belegen! 
Das ist super, gerade wenn man in mehreren Zimmern Bildschirme stehen hat und z.B. ein oder alle Fenster auf den Aktuellen Screen verschieben will, das Anzeigeprofil- oder den primären Bildschirm ändern will etc.. Sogar Soundkarten lassen sich umschalten.. (Natürlich auch per Shortcut) Nur kurz soviel um den Funktionsumfang anzuschneiden..

Auch die Generierung für Taskleisten auf den zusätzlichen Bildschirmen funktioniert wesentlich besser als bei Ultramon und bietet viel mehr Optionen.

Fazit:

10/10 - Auch den Vollpreis absolut wert!

[h1][Introduction][/h1]
I just use DisplayFusion for a while and will definitely recommend this one. If you have two monitors or more, it is really worth to try. It provides many functions and customized settings for you to manage your multiple monitors (especially in Windows 7, as you may see in other reviews or introductions).

[h1][Pros][/h1]
[list]
[*] Multi-Monitor taskbars
[*] Show Alt-Tab dialog in different monitors (combinations of main/current/all monitor(s) and all/current windows)
[*] Separated screen saver and wallpaper settings for different monitor
[*] Windows Logon management
[*] Compatible settings for different applications
[*] Triggers for some actions (window created, destroyed, ..., etc)
[*] Multi-Language (total 46 languages, 19 languages are 99%+ completed)
[*] You could install to multiple computers via Steam client
[*] ... (Maybe update later)
[/list]

[h1][Cons][/h1]
[list]
[*] If the "Show in TitleBar Buttons" in "Functions" tab is set, it seemed to result a little delay for window animations(like maximize<->minimize).
[*] Sometimes the Alt-Tab function didn't work properly after running DF for a long time (let PC go to sleep mode when you don't use it instead of powering off). Restart all the DF processes and service. All things would get back to normal.
[*] ... (Maybe update later)
[/list]

Got more than one monitor hooked up to your laptop/desktop/tower? Want some fancy monitor and wallpaper settings with your dual-monitor, tri-monitor, quad-monitor or multi-monitor setup? Then look no further and try DisplayFusion now!

Want to have opened programs in their own taskbar on the monitor it's shown in? Well you can do that with this here program. How about this; want your favourite screen saver to span across all or a specific number of monitors? Well you can do that too! How about changing your windows logon background? There are many more features(and advance ones) but I only maninly use it for these things....

A bit of nit-picking, but adding a key-combo for moving windows between screens is redundant since this exact feature already exist by default in Win7 - why add a duplicate combo that does the same thing for no reason?

DisplayFusion adds: Ctrl+Win+X
Windows7 original: Win+Shift+ArrowKey[Left/Right]

In fact the original key combos are [i]better[/i] because they make more sense in your head.

Other combos already present in windows:
Move to left/right half of current screen: Win+ArrowKey[Left/Right]
Maximize on current screen: Win+ArrowKeyUp
Maximize vertically only: Win+Shift+ArrowKeyUp
Restore/Minimize window: Win+ArrowKeyDown

That said the rest of the product is nice.

This program has major compatibility issues with Windows 8.1 and above, especially it seems if you are using ClassicShell or another similar start menu replacement program. It crashes often, and just today i restarted the computer, DF crashed on restart, and switched my primary display to my secondary monitor, lost all my pinned programs and moved the saved desktop icons and their positions to the other monitor. Ive had this problem for months now, but no fix is in sight. Does Binary Fotrtess just not care?
UPDATE
I completely uninstalled DisplayFusion, uninstalled ClassicShell, and installed another similar program called Start Menu X. I ran Windows updates, unistalled the video driver (Nvidia 780 GTX), and installed the lastest driver. Finally, I reinstalled DisplayFusion. This time, during installation, I got a popup i had not seen before about recommending to turn off the default Winodws 8.1 multi-monitor taskbar as that can cause problems. I clicked on yes, turn it off, and so far have not had the same issues I was having before. Windows 8.1 still acts really funky when I throw my 42" 4K TV into the mix, but that seems to be more of a Window issue than a DisplayFusion issue. I have to make the 4K TV the only active monitor if I want to use it with the computer, otherwise it flips out and puts half the desktop on the TV and the other half on one of the other monitors. Oh well.

프로그램 사용시간은 스팀쪽이랑 프로그램이랑 분리되어있어서 제대로 반영이 안되네요. 하루종일 켜두는데.

Когда переустановил win8.1  то понял, что, за короткое время пользования, сильно привык к DisplayFusion, 
 
Нажимаю:

1) CTRL+ALT+Shift+W ( "W" для запоминания - Wide ) - и работает один широкий (Main) монитор 21:9.
2) CTRL+ALT+Shift+Z ( "Z" для запоминания -Zoom) - и работают 3 монитора  (Main+Боковые)
3) CTRL+ALT+Shift+C (C для запоминания - Cinema) - и работает 1-н монитор + проектор, в дублирующем режиме. 

Мониторы переключаются "на лету".
-Для каждого переключения настроены разные, подходящие по размерам и задачам, обои.  
-Есть приятный выбор обоев разных форматов + с разных источников.
-Окно входа в Windows можно сменить легко, понятно и из большого визуального списка.
- Расширенный функционал у хранителей экрана("спящих" заставок).
- Одна из немногих современных программ которая: 
-не пыталась что-то, дополнительно, продать,
- не забрасывала рекламой, не требовала дополнительных регистраций 
и вступления в секту "Вечного поклонения разработчикам". 

DisplayFusion действительно добавила уюта от пользования рабочим столом.
 Не только с "насоленными" мониторами.
 Даже с 1-м монитором-
 это приятная программа для организации комфортно, интуитивно-понятно работающего рабочего стола.

19927092.review:
マルチモニターを所持している人は買って損はなし！
ホットキーであらゆる事がウインドウの調整や移動が簡単に出来る様になります。

例えば…
・最大化したウィンドウをモニター間でドラッグ可能
・指定モニターでアプリケーションを強制的に開く
・Win10のロック画面の非表示
・ウィンドウ境界線の幅を調整
・マルチモニタータスクバーをお好みに
・モニターの解像度が異なる場合、壁紙の位置をドット単位で調整できる
　（通常は隣接するモニターの解像度が異なるとズレが生じます）
・モニターごとに「解像度」と「リフレッシュレート」を設定
　（例；メインモニターは120Hzでゲーム、サブは60HzでWEBを見る）

わかりやすくて見た目が派手なので、オススメは壁紙の設定かな。
オンライン画像プロバイダーにリンクしているので、綺麗な壁紙が簡単に探せます。

などなど、細かな設定はこれでもかとありますので、思いつく限りの事が可能です。
マルチモニターで必要なウィンドウの管理はこれで万全です。

定価だと、ちょっと高い印象を受けますのが、年に数回の記念セール時に必ず、安くなるので、その時期が狙い目です。

This program is extremely versatile. It has a very slight learning curve because of how very indepth and flexible its features and options are, but it is truly a necessity if you have two or more monitors, and need to use them in different ways! 

For me, I use it with my old Wacom Cintiq 12wx (a drawing tablet with a monitor) as an illustrator/artist, which has a lower screen resolution than my main monitor - but the main monitor sometimes has to become a "slave" to the Cintiq (and thus, its screen resolution) when cloned. This program lets me switch to have different resolutions quickly (when split), change which is the master/slave, etc - not to mention what program/apps go to which monitor by default, etc.  All at the click of a button! 

I'll likely be adding another monitor soon for my hobbyist music recording as well (y'know, when you got your tracks on one side, and your mixer on another), which is gonna require a whole different monitor profile setup. =) 

Multiple monitors can really help the workflow for about any gig or hobby, I think, and this program will really make your life that much easier. Additionally, I want to give a shoutout to the developers, who are very responsive and helpful when you got questions. They deeply care about their product and it shows!

18271659.review:
Great utility for managing multiple monitors. This kind of functionality has been sorely lacking in Windows for a long time. I've owned a couple business laptops over the years that used Nvidia's nView desktop management software (which is only available for their workstation-type Quadro cards, unfortunately), and this is definitely a good substitute. It's a bit less polished than nView, but that's to be expected when you're comparing it to workstation utlities. It fixed the biggest problem I had with multiple monitors, which was simply getting programs to always start up on the active monitor. 

Now, why I actually need an additional piece of software in order to make this happen is beyond me. You'd think someone at Microsoft would've noticed by now that new windows almost always open on whatever particular monitor would be least useful for them to open on. 

^^^^  If anyone wants to mention how annoying this is to someone at Microsoft so they can fix it, I would much appreciate it, and while you're at it, let them know that whenever I click "End Process", the computer does the exact opposite, almost every single time. 

I feel like I'm under a lot of pressure to write a fair, objective, and highly informative review, based on the facts of my user experience... it probably would've been easier if I had just typed "10/10 - would buy another monitor again", or something stupid like that, rather than actually trying to tell you why I like this software.

Display Fusion does a lot of other great stuff too, and a more dedicated reviewer would take the time to tell you, dear reader, about all of it. Don't give up; you may yet find the work of such a dedicated reviewer. The last paragraph of this review will not provide an new information and is essentially a rewording of the first paragraph of this review.  

Don't let the comparison to nView deter you - this is a little less polished but it probably does more overall, if you take the time to customize it. Best software of its type that doesn't require a workstation card, as far as I know. A lot of the functionality feels like it should be a component of the OS itself, in my opinion.

I've been using DisplayFusion for a few years now, and it's exceed my expectations in nearly every way. Anyone with 2 or more monitors should have it. 

What I was looking for was a simple way to manage multiple monitor profiles because the Windows display management is severely lacking. It was a pain to connect to my HDTV, enable the display, change the audio device, and then disable my other secondary display. You're talking at least 5 separate steps to get it working correctly.

DisplayFusion made it so incredibly easy to bind a hotkey for this function. When I want to play Big Picture, I hit the hotkeys and it enables the display, makes it the primary, disables the other, and makes my desired playback device the default. On top of that, it was super simple to set up. In about 5 minutes I had it working like a dream.

Doing a little MORE digging, I found a user-made function that can do all of the above with one simple keystroke AND launch Steam in Big Picture directly. Better yet, there's a remote App for iPhone that allows me to call this function while sitting on my couch. Even better, I can use the app to switch Audio Devices on the fly when I need to hook up my headphones to avoid annoying my neighbors. 

These functions alone have made this software absolutely worth the price. I'd pay double the asking price to have them.  The window management and advanced snapping functions are the cherry on top of the cake.

It's an exceptional software, well-supported and does exactly what I wanted and more. I could not possibly be happier.

17468269.review:
I dual screen with my TV, on Win10, and this app is great for it.

A good trick to keep mind is:  if you turn off multi-monitor taskbar, and leave the taskbar on your left monitor, the icons will stay.  Sometimes when one monitor shuts off they all go over to one side or the other (stupid windows).  But, when it does that, if you unlock your taskbar, and drag it back tot he other monitor, your icons go back.   Or, you can use the built in icon location save/restore feature in this app.  Probably easier just drag your taskbar back the one in the blue moon this happens, as your dekstop icons change over time.

If you set your right monitor as your "primary" display and move taskbar and everything else to your left, your fullscreen games will awlays start on the right monitor.  right/left/center, it's all the same, you get the idea.  This lets me keep a "desktop monitor" on my regular screen and a "game/netflix" monitor on my TV.

That's not to say that this app isn't useful.  It's actually all kinds of useful, with a lot of neat features.  I think my fav feature so far is that it works with Win 10, and lets you set diff backgrounds for each monitor.  You can even set folders for it to randomly cycle through.  How cool is that?

Another cool trick is, if you don't use your desktop icons all the time, just right click your desktop, click view, and uncheck "show desktop icons".  When you want your icons back, just check the box again to show them ^.^  I mainly use my taskbar for things, but I do use my desktop now and then.  And thank god that uuuuuugly fullscreen start menu is dead in desktop mode in 10.

Win10 is still new, but works pretty well from what I've seen in being backward compatible, This great app fills in a lot of missing features in backround/desktop management.  My thanks to the developers for keeping it up to date and compatible.

An awesome compact and simple program that gives you more options with your multi-monitor setup, though you can still use it even if you only have a single monitor.

It lets you have different desktop wallpapers and screensavers on each screen, lets you change your logon screen image without breaking any registries, gives you the option to enable "screen snapping" which is like sticky windows in a sense, instantly throw windows between screens with a middle mouse button click, has a feature that "remembers the last location" of certain windows and applications (optional) and lets them open in the way you want it at all times (OCD huzzah!), remote control via free smartphone app, and the ability to "lock" your mouse cursor to the current screen with a single key or a combination of keys you can reassign. The program also lets you have a taskbar on each monitor where you can set your shortcuts, autohide them, assign their size and location and so on, pretty neat.

It has an auto-start feature and doesn't mess with your Steam, never had it crash once, and more importantly it doesn't use a lot of resources. A reliable little program that makes windows more accessible, definitely nice to keep on the side.

PS: Been using the program at all times, just never had steam record the "playtime" as I ran it off-steam - so it doesn't always show me "In-App" for no reason.

Basically, this program makes it so I no longer have to get up off my ass to do anything from my couch. I can control everything I need with hotkeys and settings. Also, there's a bunch of high quality background images that are provided if you buy it, which isn't really a huge selling point, but it is still nice to have. 16520418.review:
For some reason Steam counts this as a game. Oh well.

But it's actually a desktop customization software. It has a very expensive initial price (which I'm actually NOT going recommend) but if you can grab it on sale, totally go for it. It's the best multiple monitor software with numerous other pretty neat features. It makes your life much easier and prettier if you're into that kind of thing:
- Quite professional and proper Multiple Monitor Support software (having tried about a dozen of them, free ones tend to suck, paid ones don't seem worth it. Except this.)
- Assign different screensavers to different monitors
- Assign different wallpapers for different monitors (rescale or not, your choice)
- Extend wallpapers if you want
- Extended windows taskbar (A must have if you're using multiple monitors and an older OS than win8, since this is a native feature for win8)
- Alt-tab out of games without game screwing up. Or even manage stuff on other monitors without alt-tabbing.
- Highly customizable settings (change clock color, alpabet blabla)
- Different start menu designs (pretty nice)
- Sound efffects
- It's pretty

Overall these are the first few features that I use the most, but there is more to it than these. Most people just require only one feature of this. Still it's totally worth the sale price. Enter the advanced settings and tweak with it as you please. It's a one time purchase as there aren't any in app purchases or rip offs. But again, it's quite expensive without a sale. I grabbed it on the summer sale for a steal of 6 bucks.

Even a software with such quality and as many features should not exceed $20 anyway. I really can't see how it is worth $40.

Anwyay, quite fond of it, using it, and haven't encountered any problems so far. The only downside being the initial price, the software itself is awesome.

10/10

16489932.review:
Since I originally reviewed this in mid-2015, so many things have been added that I would be unable to list them even if I had the room to do so. Please check out the huge number of new additions since my original review; this is so much more than it was... and it was a LOT back then!!!

------------------
OLD REVIEW:

Totally worth it.

+ DisplayFusion makes working with multiple monitors and multiple configurations a breeze, whether you just want to manage multiple displays or set specific wallpaper configurations, or confine your mouse cursor to a specific region of a specific monitor, or to a specific window or a specific monitor or virtual monitor you've defined.

+ Can completely take over handling screensavers and wallpaper changes. Set what you want and be happy with your Windows configuration.

+ You can use the Windows key as part of your Ctrl+Shift+Alt+etc. hotkey definitions, something most software doesn't allow, so you have even more available!

+ Does it annoy you when you're playing a game and the taskbar or another window moves to the top (front) and messes you up by covering your game or stealing the input? This'll fix that for you. Annoyed by having your mouse cursor leave the screen and go to another screen when you're trying to do something precise? That annoyance is easy to avoid with DisplayFusion! How about when the topmost window freezes or you can't access the OS? Use a DisplayFusion-managed taskbar on another monitor (or the first) to manipulate your GUI in any way you like. Set your favorite features/scripts/etc. to run using an icon on the titlebar of the window. I can't enumerate in one review the number of features or the huge potential this software has for improving your productivity and the usability of your PC.

+ The developers are very friendly and helpful and open to suggestions for new features and ideas to implement in upcoming versions—this sofware is updated frequently and the developers are very active when it comes to solving problems, fixing bugs, writing scripts (if you're not up to scripting monitor/UI/window changes yourself), or just telling you how a feature works if it seems to work strangely on your Windows PC's hardware.

Please read the full description of features on the Store page or the website, since I probably missed a lot of what's great about this software. I also might have included a lot of information here that is already listed, or maybe what I've typed is different, because I wrote about the features that came to my mind first.

Negatives.... hmm... I don't know.

If it seems to be taking a lot of RAM or resources, you can go into the advanced configuration and turn on "run using idle priority" (paraphrased) and (whichever option tells it to clean up its RAM caches more frequently/use less RAM). Personally, I noticed no decrease in performance when I turned on those configuration options (when I had half as much RAM as I now have), yet they resulted in more RAM and CPU available for other processes. Depending upon how pedantic you are and how your box is configured, you might notice different results. Use what works best for you!

My pithy review can't do it justice, so I suggest you check out the website and forums and all the reviews if you are not sure about this great software.

DisplayFusion ist ein sehr nützliches Tool und ein Muss für jeden mit mehreren Monitoren:

Einblendung von Buttons in die Taskleiste jedes Fensters mit bestimmten Funktionen, wie z.B.:
- Verschieben des Fensters auf die Rechte / Linke Hälfte des Bildschirms
sind super nützlich.

Als Tastenkombination (oder auch Button) kann man auch noch Sachen benutzen wie:
- Das aktuelle Fenster in die den Infobereich der Taskleiste minimieren
- Den Rechner sperren
Oder was mir wirklich geholfen hat:
- Das Standardgerät für Wiedergabe mit dem Druck einer Tastenkombi direkt wechseln 
(Wenn man z.B. dauerhaft ein Headset angeschlossen hat und trotzdem manchmal Lautsprecher benutzen möchte, ohne gleich das Headset abzumachen)
Und viele weiter Funktionen.

Eine wirklich ausschlaggebende Funktion ist für mich auch noch die Möglichkeit der Einstellung, dass das Fenster, auf welchem sich der Cursor befindet, angesprochen wird. Im Sinne von Scrollen auf einer Website oder ähnlichem, ohne das Hauptprogramm in dem man grade arbeitet wirklich zu verlassen. Somit kann man auch in Fenstern scrollen ohne sie inn den Vordergrund zu rufen, was wirklich unglaublich praktisch ist und eigentlich nativ von Windows unterstützt werden sollte, wie es bei Mac OS und vielen Linux ist.

Das Speichern von Hintergrundbilder-Arrangements ist ganz nett, aber wird von den anderen Funktionen in den Schatten gestellt.

Die Anzeige der "Anwendungsdauer" musste für dieses Review sogar künstlich durch Starten der Software durch Steam hochgezählt werden (auf mind. 5 Min.), da die Software komplett ohne Anbindung an Steam läuft und einzig und allein der Produktschlüssel an den Account gebunden ist.

Alles in allem eine sehr gute Software und eine klare Kaufempfehlung!

Amazing multi monitor tool. Each monitor can get its own taskbar which only lists applications running on that monitor. You can also set an individual wallpaper per monitor, or, one that stretches across all of them.
Displayfusion also gives optional titlebar buttons and keyboard shortcuts to move, maximize, or otherwise windows across the invididual monitors.

If you have AMD Eyefinity or nVidia Surround, DF can virtually split the combined monitors again -- with optional bezel compensation -- so you can have  the full view, but still have logically confined monitors that correspond to the physical frames. Even mismatched monitors of different resolutions and locations are supported.

Another feature which I use a lot is the window location: you can optionally set it so certain applications (wildcards are supported) always open on a specific monitor. I use this to move all my windows games to the left most monitor.

If you have two or more monitors, you want this. Promised.

(Note: because of a quirk in Steam, it doesn't show proper usage stats for Displayfusion. It always starts with Windows for me and I have never once uninstalled it since first installing -- it is that good).

This is one of my favourite and personal must-haves within software. It's one of the most useful pieces of software for general desktop use, and definitely one of the very best applications on Steam. 

What does DisplayFusion do, you ask? It gives you the ability to put an individual Windows Taskbar on any monitor you'd like, aswell as let you have different wallpapers for your different monitors with relative ease. 

It lets you pin individual programs to whichever taskbar you'd like. I've got Steam, Firefox, Chrome & Pathfinder on my main, and GeForce Experience, MusicBee, Mumble, Nexus Mod Manager and Nvidia Control Panel on my secondary.  Customising and optimising your workspace is as easy as can be with this neat lil' program.

You can also create profiles for wallpapers and the like, and have your main monitor change wallpaper every 5 minutes and 13 seconds, whilst your secondary changes every 13 minutes and 37 seconds, it really doesn't matter what you want from this software - It's up to the task. 

Ofcourse the wallpaper settings let you pick whichever folder or website you'd like to pull the changing wallpapers from. DeviantArt page? No problem. A wallpaper site? No problem. Your Portal-wallpaper folder on one, and your Half-Life wallpaper folder on the other? No problem at all. Scaling the wallpaper? No problem at all! Do you want to re-align it horizontally and vertically? Easy peasy lemon squeezy. 

Customising your taskbars and desktop environments has never been this smooth, easy & fast - Sounds like PR jargon, doesn't it?, but it's the truth. I rarely recommend any sort of paid-application, however this is one that I can't help but recommend. The Steam-Pro version is the best there is, and it's incredibly cheap for what you get. This is one of just three programs I've EVER paid for, and damn if it wasn't worth every penny.

8264788.review:
This is a great piece of software for multiple monitor setups.  Rather than beat around the bush, let me get straight to the thing that I'm sure you're wondering about: this is a great alternative to UltraMon.  It's got all the important features: independent monitor wallpaper, multi-monitor "smart" taskbars, "send to other monitor" buttons added to windows, hotkeys for common multiple monitor tasks, and so on.  It even has a few new features I wasn't expecting, like background overrides for the login screen.

Configuration is pretty easy and has mostly what you would expect, along with some nice bonuses.  There's even an override function to control how DisplayFusion interacts with certain pieces of software.  I would have been happy with a simple blacklist, but this actually lets you disable or enable specific features for each program, disable features globally when certain programs are running, or if necessary stop DF from hooking into the process entirely.  It's a LOT of configuration options, and is definitely appreciated given how finickey some other software can be.

Visually, DisplayFusion is seamless for most applications.  The add-on taskbar looks and behaves exactly like the standard Windows taskbar.  Added buttons on the title bar (if enabled) look at home next to the normal Windows ones, but are offset enough that you won't snag them with a stray click. There are a few applications where the new buttons show up dramatically out of place - Steam being one of them - but that's what the override feature is for.   Mostly, DF does a good job of knowing when to be present and when not.

For the price I paid for DisplayFusion (it was on sale) I am very happy.  I'm already getting a good amount of use out of the program, and with the promise of lifetime updates this is a purchase I won't be regretting.

2151456.review:
マルチモニタ環境で必要になる機能が全て網羅されたソフトウェア。特にサブモニタのタスクバー表示は完璧な出来。
これまではdisplay fusion無料版+zbar+αとお金をかけずに運用していたが、zbarがaero使えない、universe sand boxを巻き込んで落ちる、flash playerを使ったサイトでフリーズしたりと、不安定な部分が多々あった。
display fusion有料版のみで運用するようになってからはド安定で、上記の不具合は一切起きていない。

フリーソフトを混ぜて運用してる人で、不具合発生が多い人は是非お試しを。ちょっと高いけど、日常的なストレスから解放されて満足できるはず。
